Cell.desc: A class representing a grid cell.

gridpos.desc: The position and size of the cell in the grid in columns and rows. That is in the same coordinate system that is used when adding cells to a `GridGUI.GridGUIClass`.

ctrl.desc: The control that is managed by this cell. The control class needs to implement the two methods `ControlGetPos` and `Draw` as well as have the four members `initialWidth`, `initialHeight`, `initialWidthVal` and `initialHeightVal`.

exW.desc: The horisontal expansion weight of the cell. This is used to calculate the part of the additional GUI width that this cell should take.

exH.desc: The vertical expansion weight of the cell. This is used to calculate the part of the additional GUI height that this cell should take.

fillW.desc: Whether or not to set the width of the `GridGUI.Cell.ctrl` to the width of the cell.

fillH.desc: Whether or not to set the height of the `GridGUI.Cell.ctrl` to the height of the cell.

justifyOptions.desc: How the `GridGUI.Cell.ctrl` will be positioned in the cell when drawn. Can be any combination of `C` (Center), `N` (North), `S` (South), `W` (West) and `E` (East).

borderX.desc: The horisontal border or margin of the cell that is the amount of additional width beyond what the `GridGUI.Cell.ctrl` needs that is taken up by the cell.

borderY.desc: The vertical border or margin of the cell that is the amount of additional height beyond what the `GridGUI.Cell.ctrl` needs that is taken up by the cell.

ctrlInitialPos.desc: The initial position and size of the `GridGUI.Cell.ctrl`. It is used as the min size of the `GridGUI.Cell.ctrl` if no min size is specified.

ctrlPos.desc: The position and size when the `GridGUI.Cell.ctrl` was last drawn.

pos.desc: The position and size of the cell.

othersW.desc: The combined horisontal expansion weight of other cells that this cell is in conflict with. This is used to calculate the part of the additional GUI width that this cell should take.

othersH.desc: The combined vertical expansion weight of other cells that this cell is in conflict with. This is used to calculate the part of the additional GUI height that this cell should take.

hasWConfligts.desc: Whether or not the cell needs to take any other cells into account when calculating its width.

hasHConfligts.desc: Whether or not the cell needs to take any other cells into account when calculating its height.

__FindLeastUsedRowColumn.desc: Returns the index of the where there are the lest amount of cells with a fixed size or where there is the largest expansion weight.

args.name: size
args.desc: How many indexes to check.

args.name: start
args.desc: What index to start checking from.

args.name: nonExpanders
args.desc: An array of how many fixed sized cells there are in either the columns or rows.

args.name: expanders
args.desc: An array of how many expanding cells there are in either the columns or rows.

returns.desc: The found index.

__FindLeastUsedRowColumn.comment: This is shit code. Why would it just overwrite the found index.

args.name: pos
args.desc: The position and size of the cell in the grid in columns and rows. That is in the same coordinate system that is used when adding cells to a `GridGUI.GridGUIClass`.

args.name: ctrl
args.desc: The control that will be managed by this cell. The control class needs to implement the two methods `ControlGetPos` and `Draw` as well as have the four members `initialWidth`, `initialHeight`, `initialWidthVal` and `initialHeightVal`.

args.name: exW
args.desc: The horisontal expansion weight of the cell. This is used to calculate the part of the additional GUI width that this cell should take.

args.name: exH
args.desc: The vertical expansion weight of the cell. This is used to calculate the part of the additional GUI height that this cell should take.

args.name: fillW
args.desc: Whether or not to set the width of the `GridGUI.Cell.ctrl` to the width of the cell.

args.name: fillH
args.desc: Whether or not to set the height of the `GridGUI.Cell.ctrl` to the height of the cell.

args.name: justify
args.desc: How the `GridGUI.Cell.ctrl` will be positioned in the cell when drawn. Can be any combination of `C` (Center), `N` (North), `S` (South), `W` (West) and `E` (East).

args.name: borderX
args.desc: The horisontal border or margin of the cell that is the amount of additional width beyond what the control needs that is taken up by the cell.

args.name: borderY
args.desc: The vertical border or margin of the cell that is the amount of additional height beyond what the control needs that is taken up by the cell.

returns.desc: A new `GridGUI.Cell` instance.

__Sum.desc: Calculates a partial sum of values in an array from a start index to an end index.

args.name: obj
args.desc: The array to calculate the sum of.

args.name: start
args.desc: The start index of the range to sum.

args.name: end
args.desc: The end index of the range to sum.

returns.desc: The sum of the sub-array.

args.name: area
args.desc: The area that should be centred in relation to.

args.name: pos
args.desc: The area to centre.

returns.desc: A copy of `pos` centred in `area`.

GetExpandedHeight.desc: Calculates the amount of the additional height that the cell should take up.

args.name: index
args.desc: What index of the positions in the grid that the height is wanted for.

args.name: height
args.desc: The unclaimed height of the GUI. That is the amount left after removing the combined height of all fixed size cells.

args.name: expanders
args.desc: The array of the sum of vertical expansion weights for each row.

args.name: nonExpanders
args.desc: The array of the amount of fixed size cells in each row.

returns.desc: The calculated height.

GetExpandedWidth.desc: Calculates the amount of the additional width that the cell should take up.

args.name: index
args.desc: What index of the positions in the grid that the width is wanted for.

args.name: width
args.desc: The unclaimed width of the GUI. That is the amount left after removing the combined width of all fixed size cells.

args.name: expanders
args.desc: The array of the sum of horisontal expansion weights for each column.

args.name: nonExpanders
args.desc: The array of the amount of fixed size cells in each column.

returns.desc: The calculated width.
The vertical expansion weight.
The horisontal expansion weight.

GetFixedHeight.desc: Returns the fixed height of the cell.

returns.desc: The fixed height of the cell. For non vertically expanding and non vertically filling cells the min-height of the `GridGUI.Cell.ctrl` plus 2 times the vertical margin is returned. For vertically expanding and or vertically filling cells 0 is returned unless an min-height where specified in which case the min-height of the `GridGUI.Cell.ctrl` plus 2 time the vertical margin is returned unless the min-height is 0 then 0 is returned.

GetFixedWidth.desc: Returns the fixed width of the cell.

returns.desc: The fixed width of the cell. For non horisontally expanding and non horisontally filling cells the min-width of the `GridGUI.Cell.ctrl` plus 2 times the horisontal margin is returned. For horisontally expanding and or horisontally filling cells 0 is returned unless an min-width where specified in which case the min-width of the `GridGUI.Cell.ctrl` plus 2 time the vertical margin is returned unless the min-width is 0 then 0 is returned.

GetNeededHeight.desc: Returns the needed height of the cell.

returns.desc: The needed height of the cell. That is the min-height of the `GridGUI.Cell.ctrl` plus two times the vertical margin.

GetNeededWidth.desc: Returns the needed width of the cell.

returns.desc: The needed width of the cell. That is the min-width of the `GridGUI.Cell.ctrl` plus two times the horisontal margin.

Justify.desc: Justifies an area within another area. That is places the area according to a set of rules within the larger area.

args.name: area
args.desc: The area to position the other area within.

args.name: pos
args.desc: The area to position in the larger area.

returns.desc: A copy of `pos` that is justified within `area`.

SetArea.desc: Sets the position and size of the cell.

args.name: offset
args.desc: The coordinate offset that the cell should be translated by. Used to support `GridGUI.SubGrid`s within a GUI, since the calculated positions are relative to the client area.

args.name: widths
args.desc: An array of the calculate width for each column.

args.name: heights
args.desc: An array of the calculate height for each row.

SetCtrlSize.desc: Calculates the size the `GridGUI.Cell.ctrl` should use given a specific cell size.

args.name: pos
args.desc: The size to fit the `GridGUI.Cell.ctrl` within.

returns.desc: An area sized according to the cell members to fit within `pos`.

ToolTip.desc: Shows a tooltip of the cell as a string.

ToStr.desc: Converts the object to a string.

args.name: indent
args.desc: The amount of indentation to add on each line.

returns.desc: A string representing this cell.

Update.desc: Updates the position of the `GridGUI.Cell.ctrl` and draws it.

Column.desc: A class representing a grid column.

index.desc: The index of the column in the grid.

cells.desc: A collection of arrays of `GridGUI.Cell`s indexed by the index of the rows they are placed on.

fixedWidth.desc: The maximal fixed width of the cells, that is the largest fixed width for a cell in `GridGUI.Column.cells`.

minWidth.desc: The maximal minimal width for the cells, that is the largest minimal width for a cell in `GridGUI.Column.cells`.

expanders.desc: The sum of all the horisontal expansion weights of cells that are in this column.

expanderMaxValue.desc: The largest horisontal expansion weight in this column.

nonExpanders.desc: The amount of cells with fixed size in this column.

catched.desc: Whether or not the members have already been calculate.

confligtingExpanders.desc: A collection of cells that have horisontal expansion conflicts.

__CalculateConfligtingExpanders.desc: Updates `GridGUI.Column.confligtingExpanders` with the `GridGUI.Cell` for a cell if it has horisontal conflicts.

args.name: c
args.desc: The `GridGUI.Cell` to retrieve the value from.

__CalculateExpanders.desc: Updates `GridGUI.Column.expanders` with the result of `GridGUI.Cell.GetExpansionWidthValue` for a cell.

args.name: c
args.desc: The `GridGUI.Cell` to retrieve the value from.

__CalculateFixedWidth.desc: Updates `GridGUI.Column.fixedWidth` with the result of `GridGUI.Cell.GetFixedWidth` for a cell if it is larger than the previous value.

args.name: c
args.desc: The `GridGUI.Cell` to retrieve the value from.

__CalculateMinWidth.desc: Updates `GridGUI.Column.minWidth` with the result of `GridGUI.Cell.GetNeededWidth` for a cell if it is larger than the previous value.

args.name: c
args.desc: The `GridGUI.Cell` to retrieve the value from.

__CalculateNonExpanders.desc: Increments `GridGUI.Column.nonExpanders` if the `GridGUI.Cell` does not expand horisontally.

args.name: c
args.desc: The `GridGUI.Cell` to retrieve the value from.

args.name: index
args.desc: The index of the column in the grid.

returns.desc: A new `GridGUI.Column` instance.

__ResetConstants.desc: Resets the cached `GridGUI.Column` members to their default values.

args.name: c
args.desc: The `GridGUI.Cell` to added to the column.

CalculateConstants.desc: Calculates the values for the `GridGUI.Column` members that are cached.

CalculateWidth.desc: Calculates the width of the column.

args.name: width
args.desc: The width of the grid, that is the width of the GUI or subgrid.

args.name: expanders
args.desc: An array of the sum of horisontal expansion weights for each column.

args.name: nonExpanders
args.desc: An array of the amount of fixed size cells in each column.

returns.desc: The width of the column.
The largest horisontal expansion weight of a cell in the column.
The sum of horisontal expansion weight of cells in the column.
The largest fixed width of a cell in the column.
The largest minimal width of a cell in the column.
The amount of cells with fixed width in the column.

args.name: c
args.desc: The `GridGUI.Cell` to remove from the column.

Columns.desc: A class managing a collection of `GridGUI.Column`s.

columns.desc: A collection of the `GridGUI.Column`s where one or more `GridGUI.Cell`s have been placed. That is only used columns are generated.

fixedWidths.desc: A collection of the fixed width of each `GridGUI.Column` in `GridGUI.Columns.columns`.

minWidths.desc: A collection of the min width of each `GridGUI.Column` in `GridGUI.Columns.columns`.

expanders.desc: A collection of the sum of horisontal `GridGUI.Cell` expansion weights of each `GridGUI.Column` in `GridGUI.Columns.columns`.

expandersMaxValue.desc: A collection of the maximum horisontal `GridGUI.Cell` expansion weight of each `GridGUI.Column` in `GridGUI.Columns.columns`.

nonExpanders.desc: A collection of the amount of horisontally fixed `GridGUI.Cell`s in each `GridGUI.Column` in `GridGUI.Columns.columns`.

catched.desc: Whether or not the members have already been calculate.

returns.desc: A new `GridGUI.Columns` instance.

__ResetConstants.desc: Resets the cached `GridGUI.Columns` members to their default values.

Add.desc: Adds a `GridGUI.Cell` to the `GridGUI.Column`s that it spans over. If the `GridGUI.Column`s are not already in `GridGUI.Columns.columns` they are added before adding the cell.

args.name: c
args.desc: The `GridGUI.Cell` to add to the `GridGUI.Column`s.

CalculateConstants.desc: Calculates the values for the `GridGUI.Columns` members that are cached.

CalculateWidths.desc: Calculates the part of the available width that each `GridGUI.Column` in `GridGUI.Columns.columns` will get.

args.name: width
args.desc: The width of the grid. That is the width that the grid should fill.

args.name: expanders
args.desc: The member `GridGUI.Columns.expanders`

args.name: nonExpanders
args.desc: The member `GridGUI.Columns.nonExpanders`

returns.desc: The calculated widths of the `GridGUI.Column`s in `GridGUI.Columns.columns`.

GetFixedWidth.desc: Returns the sum of the fixed widths of the `GridGUI.Column`s in `GridGUI.Columns.columns`.

returns.desc: The sum of the fixed widths of the `GridGUI.Column`s in `GridGUI.Columns.columns`.

GetMinWidth.desc: Returns the sum of the minimal widths of the `GridGUI.Column`s in `GridGUI.Columns.columns`.

returns.desc: The sum of the minimal widths of the `GridGUI.Column`s in `GridGUI.Columns.columns`.

ReduceToGuiSize.desc: Fixes miscalculations in the width of expanding `GridGUI.Cell`s by reducing their width down until they all fit in the available width or all have reach their min width. The reduction is done starting with the widest `GridGUI.Column` to the thinnest.

args.name: widths
args.desc: The calculated widths for the `GridGUI.Column`s in `GridGUI.Columns.columns`.

args.name: expandedWidths
args.desc: An array of the widths of `GridGUI.Column`s with one or more horisontally expanding `GridGUI.Cell` if the current width in `widths` corresponding to the column is larger than the minimum of the column otherwise it wont be included in the `expandedWidths`

args.name: sumExpandedWidths
args.desc: The sum of the widths in `expandedWidths`.

args.name: excessWidth
args.desc: The amount of width that the sum of `widths` would exceed the width of the grid/gui.

Remove.desc: Removes a `GridGUI.Cell` from the `GridGUI.Column`s that it spans over. If the `GridGUI.Column`s are empty after removing the cell the column will be removed as well.

args.name: c
args.desc: The `GridGUI.Cell` to remove from the `GridGUI.Column`s.

ExpanderArbitrator.desc: A class that try to find cells that conflict and resolve the conflicts.

Grid.desc: A class representing a grid with rows, columns and cells.

cells.desc: An array of the `GridGUI.Cell`s that have been added to the grid.

arbitrator.desc: An instance of `GridGUI.ExpanderArbitrator` that keeps tack of the expanding `GridGUI.Cell`s in the grid.

rows.desc: An instance of `GridGUI.Rows` that keeps tack of the `GridGUI.Row`s comprising the grid.

columns.desc: An instance of `GridGUI.Columns` that keeps tack of the `GridGUI.Column`s comprising the grid.

returns.desc: A new `GridGUI.Grid` instance.

AddCell.desc: Adds a `GridGUI.Cell` to the grid in the rows and columns indicated by the `GridGUI.Cell.gridpos` member of the cell.

args.name: c
args.desc: The `GridGUI.Cell` to add to the grid.

CalculatePositions.desc: Calculates the positions and sizes of the `GridGUI.Cell`s in the grid and draws them.

args.name: area
args.desc: The position and size of the grid. This is needed to support `GridGUI.SubGrid`s.

GetMinHeight.desc: Returns the minimal needed height to show the `GridGUI.Cell`s.

returns.desc: The minimal needed height to show the `GridGUI.Cell`s

GetMinWidth.desc: Returns the minimal needed width to show the `GridGUI.Cell`s.

returns.desc: The minimal needed width to show the `GridGUI.Cell`s

RemoveCell.desc: Removes a `GridGUI.Cell` from the grid by removing it from the rows and columns it was in, as well as removing it from the `GridGUI.Grid.arbitrator`.

args.name: c
args.desc: The `GridGUI.Cell` to remove from the grid.

ResetConstants.desc: Resets the cached constants of the members.

Row.desc: A class representing a grid row.

index.desc: The index of the row in the grid.

cells.desc: A collection of arrays of `GridGUI.Cell`s indexed by the index of the columns they are placed on.

fixedWidth.desc: The sum of the maximal fixed heights for each column, that is the sum of the largest fixed height for each array of overlapping cells in `GridGUI.Column.cells`.

minWidth.desc: The sum of the maximal minimal heights for each column, that is the sum of the largest minimal height for each array of overlapping cells in `GridGUI.Column.cells`.

expanders.desc: The sum of all the vertical expansion weights of cells that are in this row.

expanderMaxValue.desc: The largest vertical expansion weight in this row.

nonExpanders.desc: The amount of cells with fixed size in this row.

catched.desc: Whether or not the members have already been calculate.

confligtingExpanders.desc: A collection of cells that have vertical expansion conflicts.

__CalculateConfligtingExpanders.desc: Updates `GridGUI.Row.confligtingExpanders` with the `GridGUI.Cell` for a cell if it has vertical conflicts.

args.name: c
args.desc: The `GridGUI.Cell` to retrieve the value from.

__CalculateExpanders.desc: Updates `GridGUI.Row.expanders` with the result of `GridGUI.Cell.GetExpansionHeightValue` for a cell.

args.name: c
args.desc: The `GridGUI.Cell` to retrieve the value from.

__CalculateFixedHeight.desc: Updates `GridGUI.Row.fixedHeight` with the result of `GridGUI.Cell.GetFixedHeight` for a cell if it is larger than the previous value.

args.name: c
args.desc: The `GridGUI.Cell` to retrieve the value from.

__CalculateMinHeight.desc: Updates `GridGUI.Row.minHeight` with the result of `GridGUI.Cell.GetNeededHeight` for a cell if it is larger than the previous value.

args.name: c
args.desc: The `GridGUI.Cell` to retrieve the value from.

__CalculateNonExpanders.desc: Increments `GridGUI.Row.nonExpanders` if the `GridGUI.Cell` does not expand vertically.

args.name: c
args.desc: The `GridGUI.Cell` to retrieve the value from.

args.name: index
args.desc: The index of the row in the grid.

returns.desc: A new `GridGUI.Row` instance.

__ResetConstants.desc: Resets the cached `GridGUI.Row` members to their default values.

args.name: c
args.desc: The `GridGUI.Cell` to added to the row.

CalculateConstants.desc: Calculates the values for the `GridGUI.Row` members that are cached.

CalculateHeight.desc: Calculates the height of the row.

args.name: height
args.desc: The height of the grid, that is the height of the GUI or subgrid.

args.name: expanders
args.desc: An array of the sum of vertical expansion weights for each row.

args.name: nonExpanders
args.desc: An array of the amount of fixed size cells in each row.

returns.desc: The height of the row.
The largest vertical expansion weight of a cell in the row.
The sum of vertical expansion weight of cells in the row.
The largest fixed height of a cell in the row.
The largest minimal height of a cell in the row.
The amount of cells with fixed height in the row.

args.name: c
args.desc: The `GridGUI.Cell` to remove from the row.

Rows.desc: A class managing a collection of `GridGUI.Row`s.

rows.desc: A collection of the `GridGUI.Row`s where one or more `GridGUI.Cell`s have been placed. That is only used rows are generated.

fixedHeights.desc: A collection of the fixed height of each `GridGUI.Row` in `GridGUI.Rows.rows`.

minHeights.desc: A collection of the min height of each `GridGUI.Row` in `GridGUI.Rows.rows`.

expanders.desc: A collection of the sum of vertical `GridGUI.Cell` expansion weights of each `GridGUI.Row` in `GridGUI.Rows.rows`.

expandersMaxValue.desc: A collection of the maximum vertical `GridGUI.Cell` expansion weight of each `GridGUI.Row` in `GridGUI.Rows.rows`.

nonExpanders.desc: A collection of the amount of vertically fixed `GridGUI.Cell`s in each `GridGUI.Row` in `GridGUI.Rows.rows`.

catched.desc: Whether or not the members have already been calculate.

returns.desc: A new `GridGUI.Rows` instance.

__ResetConstants.desc: Resets the cached `GridGUI.Rows` members to their default values.

Add.desc: Adds a `GridGUI.Cell` to the `GridGUI.Row`s that it spans over. If the `GridGUI.Row`s are not already in `GridGUI.Rows.rows` they are added before adding the cell.

args.name: c
args.desc: The `GridGUI.Cell` to add to the `GridGUI.Row`s.

CalculateConstants.desc: Calculates the values for the `GridGUI.Rows` members that are cached.

CalculateHeights.desc: Calculates the part of the available height that each `GridGUI.Row` in `GridGUI.Rows.rows` will get.

args.name: height
args.desc: The height of the grid. That is the height that the grid should fill.

args.name: expanders
args.desc: The member `GridGUI.Rows.expanders`

args.name: nonExpanders
args.desc: The member `GridGUI.Rows.nonExpanders`

returns.desc: The calculated heights of the `GridGUI.Row`s in `GridGUI.Rows.rows`.

GetFixedHeight.desc: Returns the sum of the fixed heights of the `GridGUI.Row`s in `GridGUI.Rows.rows`.

returns.desc: The sum of the fixed heights of the `GridGUI.Row`s in `GridGUI.Rows.rows`.

GetMinHeight.desc: Returns the sum of the minimal heights of the `GridGUI.Row`s in `GridGUI.Rows.rows`.

returns.desc: The sum of the minimal heights of the `GridGUI.Row`s in `GridGUI.Rows.rows`.

ReduceToGuiSize.desc: Fixes miscalculations in the height of expanding `GridGUI.Cell`s by reducing their height down until they all fit in the available height or all have reach their min height. The reduction is done starting with the tallest `GridGUI.Row` to the shortest.

args.name: heights
args.desc: The calculated heights for the `GridGUI.Row`s in `GridGUI.Rows.rows`.

args.name: expandedHeights
args.desc: An array of the heights of `GridGUI.Row`s with one or more vertically expanding `GridGUI.Cell` if the current height in `heights` corresponding to the row is larger than the minimum of the row otherwise it wont be included in the `expandedHeights`

args.name: sumExpandedHeights
args.desc: The sum of the heights in `expandedHeights`.

args.name: excessHeight
args.desc: The amount of height that the sum of `heights` would exceed the height of the grid/gui.

Remove.desc: Removes a `GridGUI.Cell` from the `GridGUI.Row`s that it spans over. If the `GridGUI.Row`s are empty after removing the cell the row will be removed as well.

args.name: c
args.desc: The `GridGUI.Cell` to remove from the `GridGUI.Row`s.

Util.desc: A collection of utility methods used by this lib.
